messages: 6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:23): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: About to release another "shit brix" youtube video. ;D
38e5971429bb0f30aa410ac1ae0bb9a9 (03:23): (1 hour 57 mins ago) &lt 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049> tell 6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 saw chris is all over your bug. \o/
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:24): maybe soon with chromium if the web audio api doesn't hang after x seconds when crogers fixes this weird bug specific to it.

6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:29): "I used to set my own sample rate into createBuffer, but the api seemed to ignore my value, so I'm stuck using some arbitrary sample rate. I need 70khz for a special WAV PCM RAM emulation, otherwise it sounds like crap to put it simply."
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:29): Pikachu won't say pikachu in pokemon yellow if the sample rate is somewhere below 70 khz
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:36): has analyzed the assembly code patterns used for WAV PCM RAM updating, and this is why I selected 70khz.
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (03:36): yeah i did that too. i picked 120hz. IN YO FACE
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:37): and you can audibly hear the difference between 70khz and 44.1khz
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:38): actually the js GBA emulator has a LOWER sample rate
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:38): because a lot of the audio is DMA'd in at a low sample rate
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:39): as in since it has no dma, the raw audio samples are loaded and stored into the wav pcm ram i/o registers directly by the cpu.
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:40): the GBA has that option too, but uses it far less
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:40): because doing this is generally bad due to tearing via the internal shadow playback sample position.
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:42): has a shitload of buffer under-run detection logic for webkit's audio api path.
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:43): and counters that have to have every case logic covered.
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (03:43): well that's the blessing and curse of pushing new features to their limits
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (03:43): sucks that your ideas can't be completely realized, awesome that you pave the way for future devs
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:44): just wait for my newest shit brix youtube video
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (03:51): has to minimal 1:1 so safari doesn't slow the fuck down. :/
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (04:05): shit brix with safari - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BfRq-TEKlPo shit brix with firefox - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dZ5gE8KkT0s
